title: cryptogeniusdice
author: cryptogeniusdice
content: A part from provablyfair.me can you provide me a thirdparty website where i can verify my bet results.Because we know provablyfair.me is owned by MeeBit , which is a subsidary of stake.comso basically you guys can print whatever you want.

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: You should post your question in the Gambling board, you will have more interest and answers from users.

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Well, Op I had nothing to do with what you have done or what they are doing simply this topic is inappropriate here. This is not the FAQ section or customer support section. Not even Gambling Discussion so please to the relevant board. The sole purpose of Section 1 is Bitcoin Discussion. So from now onward, I am expecting you to never repeat the basic mistake because, from your Querrey and Tittle, it is not at all difficult to guess the Section where to post.

comments.author: cryptogeniusdice
comments.body: i am sorry , i dont know hiw to tag it . i just create post. can any moderator help me to tag it to correct group and also tag stunna.

comments.author: Bitinity
comments.body: Quote from: cryptogeniusdice on July 27, 2023, 09:23:20 AMA part from provablyfair.me can you provide me a thirdparty website where i can verify my bet results.Maybe BTCGOSU can be your alternative place to verify your bets. BTCGOSU is known to be reputable independent review website that provide honest review of many online crypto casinos. Aside from the review, they also provide provably fair checker/verifier and it is currently available for 27 casinos including Stake. Below is the direct link to BTCGOSU provably fair verifier:https://www.btcgosu.com/tools/provably-fair-verifier/

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: If Stake.com is giving you the hash of every bet you made then maybe the old ways below can help you verify the hash if they are fair or not it was tested on Dice Casino and it should also work on other Crypto casinos.- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5235045.0

comments.author: cryptogeniusdice
comments.body: the btcgous there is no mines calculator. cannot find any mines calculator there.

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: Quote from: cryptogeniusdice on July 27, 2023, 02:17:06 PMthe btcgous there is no mines calculator. cannot find any mines calculator there.Or you could directly ask support in their Stake Ann thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2072589.0How about this https://provablefair.altervista.org/faucet-game/stake/mines/I'm not sure if it's going to work but it's for mines and seems specific for Stake too. Maybe Stake could put a list of alternative for users to use if some doesn't trust their own verifier. It's normal nowadays not to trust the casino they were playing.

comments.author: Casdinyard
comments.body: Just ask for direct assistance in their announcement thread here:Â  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2072589.0, that's the only way you could get a definitive answer from your question. You could also just use another provably fair tester along with the ones that they sanctioned just so you'd have the peace of mind that they are not screwing you over. As for mines, I don't really know if such a feature exists since those games are randomized at best although you can try scouring the internet for answers for that. At the end of the day we can guarantee that your doubts over the validity of odds in stake are understandable and fine, but would be clarified once you find the proper answers you're looking for.
